sentences.english: You will take a chance in something in the near future.
sentences.chinese: 在不遠將來發生的事情中你會佔足先機。

sentences.english: Let's anticipate the enemy's move and occupy that city.
sentences.chinese: 我們要制敵先機搶先攻佔那個城市。

sentences.english: Certainly, it can't rule out some people wanna be leading-edge by starting to talk.
sentences.chinese: 當然，並不排除有些人先開口想佔盡先機。

sentences.english: So here are some tips to give you a head start.
sentences.chinese: 那麼，以下是一些能讓你佔得先機的小貼士。

sentences.english: Remember maintaining a healthy lifestyle gives you a head-start on beating stress.
sentences.chinese: 記住，堅持健康的生涯方法能給你克服壓力的先機。

sentences.english: Our philosophy base on fine creativity, grasp the chance and win the future.
sentences.chinese: 我們的信念是“創造卓越，贏得先機，贏是未來”。

sentences.english: The offerer is even advantaged in an acquisition from end to end.
sentences.chinese: 收購人更是在許多方面佔盡先機。

sentences.english: The Chinese have the early advantage in executing cyber warfare.
sentences.chinese: 中國在開展網絡戰爭中佔有先機優勢。

sentences.english: They develop leads by building relationships gradually over time.
sentences.chinese: 他們通過逐步建立關係網，佔領先機。

sentences.english: Preemptive strikes are okay when you know for sure what you're preempting.
sentences.chinese: 當你確信你所佔的先機，先發制人未嘗不可。

sentences.english: For the government, the task is to get ahead of the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 對政府來說，首要任務就是要快速反應，搶佔先機。

sentences.english: But it should move fast. Rivals have a head start.
sentences.chinese: 但它應該趕快行動，因爲競爭對手已經佔得先機。

sentences.english: The art of trading exists in stacking the odds in your favor and building an edge.
sentences.chinese: 交易的藝術在於積累有利於你的可能性並佔得先機。

sentences.english: Many competitors advance to the next round.
sentences.chinese: 許多競爭對手在下一輪競爭中可能搶得先機。

definition: in an instant a myriad changes (idiom); rapid substantial change
extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
ability to have one's say and be listened to/influence/clout
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
railtrack connection/to integrate into sth/to dock/to connect/to be in step with/to bring into line with/to align
to advance by leaps and bounds
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
